decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly getting big creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand into play by using cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. It also includes efficient card draw and control spells to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to cheat out powerful threats early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. It utilizes lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to generate extra mana and gain a tempo advantage. This combo-based strategy is designed to win quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient Merfolk creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Silvergill Adept, supported by lords such as Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis to boost their power. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cursecatcher and Merfolk Trickster to control the opponent's actions. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play, while cards like Force of Will and Daze provide protection and counterplay. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy while maintaining control over the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a massive advantage. Cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting help to streamline the process, while disruption cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize are included to protect the combo. The overall goal is to efficiently cheat big threats into play early in the game, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and counterspells such as Force of Will and Spell Pierce. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, which can help gain board advantage. True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer threat, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provide card advantage and control tools. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Back to Basics and Council's Judgment to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and out-valuing opponents.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on locking down the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also ramping out powerful threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, Scion of Urza. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss. By utilizing fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox, this deck can quickly establish board control and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

The focus of this deck is to use Cloudpost ramp and powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing mana acceleration cards like Grim Monolith and Trinisphere, the deck aims to cast large Eldrazi threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, the Great Distortion ahead of schedule. Additionally, disruptive elements like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void help control the game state and hinder opposing strategies. Ultimately, the deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game with its high-impact threats.

Utilizing a mix of efficient removal, disruptive spells, and card advantage engines, Grixis Control aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's game plan and eventually out-value them with powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Kolaghan's Command. By utilizing cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage for card advantage and Gurmag Angler as a finisher, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through attrition. The deck's mana base is optimized to support its powerful spells, allowing it to have consistent access to its key cards throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's resources and limit their options through various means such as countering spells, removing threats, and preventing graveyard interactions. The deck utilizes cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Rest in Peace to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes win conditions like Helm of Obedience and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Detention Sphere and Humility further solidify the control aspect of the deck.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to tax the opponent's resources and slow them down, it creates opportunities for quick wins with powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull. Additionally, the inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment and game-changing flicker effects with Flickerwisp. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and utilize its disruptive elements to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

This Legacy Death & Taxes deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plans with hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, while also providing aggressive threats with cards like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. Utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to cheat out powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, this deck aims to control the board and apply pressure on opponents. With disruption in the form of Phyrexian Revoker and Sanctum Prelate, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while presenting a clock to close out the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with discard spells like Hymn to Tourach and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also controlling the board with cards like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to generate card advantage and close out the game. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Baleful Strix, along with counterspells like Force of Will. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outplay the opponent through efficient card selection and disruption.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal to control the game while utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment cards like Sword of Fire and Ice, Batterskull, and Umezawa's Jitte to gain individual card advantage. The inclusion of Meddling Mage allows for targeted disruption against specific strategies, while True-Name Nemesis provides a resilient threat that is difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient use of resources and strategic decision-making.
